newsitem.title: ETHIOPIA: Ethiopian police kill leader of underground group.
newsitem.headline: Ethiopian police kill leader of underground group.

text.p: Ethiopian police killed the leader of a violent underground group in the capital Addis Ababa on Thursday and detained several members, state radio said.
The leader, Assefa Maru of the Ethiopian United Patriotic Front, had resisted arrest and tried to flee, it said.
Police found three Kalashnikov assault rifles and several bombs, it added, quoting the police.

The previous leader of the group, university professor Taye Wolde-Semayate, was arrested last June and police said at the time the group was planning to assassinate government officials and foreigners. His case is pending in court.

Last month one person was killed and 86 were injured in grenade attacks on a supermarket, a restaurant and two hotels frequented by foreigners in Addis Ababa and the eastern town of Dire Dawa. No one has claimed responsibility.
A police statement last June said the movement also planned to force wealthy individuals to pay contributions and to carry out armed robberies of government institutions and companies.
